intro: Epilobium mundtii, commonly known as the Pacific willow, is a flowering plant native to western North America. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows along stream banks and moist soils. The plant produces showy, pink to reddish-purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often covered in fine hairs. Epilobium mundtii plays an important ecological role by providing habitat and food for various insects and wildlife.
